description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 10a, line 5. Manuscript erroneously foliated beginning on first flyleaf. Record follows erroneous foliation. Physical description: 13 lines per page; written in neat naskh in black on tan glazed, laid Arabic paper. Text framed in red; crudely illuminated basmalah at head of text on leaf 9b. Rubrication and catchwords; extensive marginal and interlinear notes. Damp-stained across upper edge. Origin: 20 Jumādá II 1009 H [27 December 1600] in Aradabīl, by Ibn Shaykhshāh Muḥammad Salmān (leaf 367a). Incipit: الحمد لله المتفرد بالقدم والدوام المتنزه عن مشابهة الاعراض والاجسام
author: Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī, al-Ḥasan ibn Yūsuf, 1250-1325
abstract: Treatise on Shiʻite fiqh. Text is on leaves 9b-367a and is preceded by prayers, poetry, schematic drawings, and notes on leaves 3a-8a.
extent: 366 leaves : paper ; 192 x 118 (120 x 55) mm bound to 198 x 121 mm
title: Irshād al-adhhān ilá aḥkām al-īmān.
provenance: Owner's stamp of Muḥammad Salmān (scribe) on leaves 8a, 367a. Title written on the first flyleaf and dated 1333 H [1914 or 1915].
creator: ابن المطهر الحلي، الحسن بن يوسف، 1250-1325
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
binding note: Full red leather with marbled paper doublures.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
